actions.message:
You are expected to treat every single person in this server, staff or not, with respect. Any toxicity or disrespect is prohibited, and you will be punished accordingly.

Any racism, no matter the context, is not allowed. Yes, this does include the n word, as well as any other racial slurs. 

Any and all pictures or videos should go into the #media channel. Staff are excluded from this rule.

Any forms of harassment will not be tolerated. 

Spamming is strictly prohibited. Any form of spamming (3+ of the same message sent in a short amount of time.) is not allowed.

Advertising of any kind, without permission from the Manager or Owner, will result in a ban, warn, or mute.

Any threats will not be taken as a joke. You will be punished depending on the severity of the threat. (DDos threats, etc etc)

Follow both Roblox and Discord TOS. (This means you must be 13 years or older to join Wendigo.)

Follow all faction guidelines in the official Ro-Ghoul server.

Mic Spam (Screaming through your mic in a voice channel) is not allowed, and will result in a mute.

NSFW content is not allowed.

You will be notified if this is updated, or changed in any way. You are expected to read this.

If you know any of the Swedish language, you are automatically 75% cooler than anyone else in this server.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
[Rule 1] You must follow all orders given to you by your trainer. Failure to follow orders will result in warnings, and then a removal of the training. 

[Rule 2] You must follow PTS if it is active. If you do not know what PTS is, read #training-information. 

[Rule 3] If you need to go AFK, as for PTS, and inform the trainer that you will be AFK. Follow any instructions that the trainer tells you to (for example, face the wall if you are AFK)

[Rule 4] Respect all members and trainers during a training. 

[Rule 5] Do not ask for PTS if you are going to say something useless. 

[Rule 6] Follow all rules listed in #rules.

 
Any updates will be posted in the #‚ùóupdates channel. Failure to follow these rules will result in punishment.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
This channel will have all materials needed to join, and complete a training. 
:transparent: 
PTS, STS, SFL, what does this all mean?
PTS means Permission to Speak. If a trainer says "PTS is active", they mean that you need permission to speak, before you speak. You can ask for permission by simply typing "PTS" in-game, and wait for a trainer to either grant or deny your request.
STS means Shoulder to Shoulder. This is most commonly used when asking members to go into the arena and STS. To get into STS, you need to put the shoulders of your avatar directly next to the shoulders of another members avatar.
SFL means single file line. This means that everyone needs to get into 1 line.

What are warnings? What happens if I get one?

Warnings are used to make sure that nobody misbehaves during a training. You can recieve warnings for speaking without permission, not following orders, etc etc. If you receive 3 warnings, you will be asked to leave the training.

What activities will there be in the training?

In a training, there are a variety of activities that you may see. It is entirely up to a trainer as to how many of these activities they will do, and which ones they will do. A list of common activities will be listed below.
Gladiator: 2 team captains will be chosen, who will create teams. These 2 teams will fight, however there is a twist. In gladiators, one member of team 1 will fight a member of team 2. If the member of team 1 dies, another member of team 1 will come down and immediately fight the member of team 2. If that member of team 2 dies, another member of team 2 will come down to fight. This will continue until one team has no more remaining members.
Team fights: In team fights, 2 team captains will be chosen to select teams. These teams will fight each other. Pretty self explanatory.
1v1s: One person will fight another person, very simple.
Trainings will be posted in #training-announcements. If you would like to receive pings for trainings, go to the self-roles channel and get "Training Notifications"
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Bounty System

To get points from the bounty system, you must kill people on the bounty list. These players listed on the bounty list will have reasons for being on it (toxicity, rking, etc) and if you kill them, you need to take a screenshot of you next to their body (with their name showing) and send it to the bounty kills channel. You can kill each person 1 time. If you wish to add someone to the bounty list (for being toxic, etc etc) then you must message a moderator, and they will put it on there for you. If you need any help with the bounty system, message a moderator. Our allies cannot be put on the KOS list, if you need to report a member of our allies, go to their respective Discord and report them to a moderator there.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Section 1 - Bot Usage.
I am the bot that you will use for all moderation. My prefix is ?, and I am able to mute, kick, warn, and ban users. Command formats can be found below:
Ban - ?ban @user (This will perm ban a user.)
Mute - ?mute @user time (The time is in minutes, if you want to mute someone for an hour, you would put 60.
Warn - ?warn @user reason (They will be DM'd with the person that warned them, as well as what they were warned for.)
Kick - ?kick @user (This will remove a user from the server, however they are able to join back.)
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Section 2 - Do I mute, kick, or ban somebody?
If you are unsure if you should mute, kick, ban, or warn somebody, you should think about the severity of the offense. For example, if someone sent a hateful message towards someone once, you shouldn't resort to a ban right away, instead you should talk with the person, and then determine what you should do. Now, most of the time, you won't ban right away. If someone is spamming, depending on the severity, you should warn or mute them. However, everything said here can vary based on how many times they do it. Sending the same message 1-3 times should result in a warn to a user, however if it is more than that it should go to a mute, kick, or ban, however you should only ban if it is clear that they have no intent to stop.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Section 3 - Abuse of power.
If you are found abusing your commands, you will most likely be kicked off the staff team, and put back down to an LR. Depending on the severity of your offense, you may be put on suspension to come back to moderating at a later date, or be banned from Wendigo entirely. 
You are not to mute, ban, kick, or warn anybody for no reason. This all falls under the "Abuse of power" category, and you will be punished as stated above.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Section 4 - Staff expectations. 
You are to respect all members, no matter any past history that you may have had with any individual(s). You are a moderator to moderate the server, not to act better than everyone else. If you encounter a rule breaker, you are to deal with them no matter what, even if they are your friend. Nobody here should feel disrespected.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message: Welcome to Wendigo! In this clan, we rank based off of your in-game level. In order to be properly ranked in this server, you need to send a screenshot of your entire screen into #proof-of-level. If you do not have a screenshot of your entire screen, you will not be ranked. You also need to hold down V when taking screenshots, so that your stats are showing. Once you've done all that, post a picture in #proof-of-level and wait for someone to rank you.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Hey there random newcomer! You're probably wondering, "what the heck are all these roles, how do I get them!?"
Here is the place where you will learn what roles are, what they do, and how to get them!


Guest - Anyone that has this role is not in Wendigo, and is simply a guest to our Discord server. They are most likely cooler than anyone else you'll meet :)

Member - Anyone who is verified is given the member role. This is the role that most of the community has.

Training/Reinforcements/Giveaways - These roles are given to people who want to be notified when events happen. Head over to #ü§ñself-roles to get yourself some fancy roles.

member who is cooler than you - As stated in the name, this is a member that is cooler than the rest of the members. You will get this if I want you to get it.

Trainer - This is a member of staff. Trainers host trainings (duh) and other events. You can get this role by applying whenever applications are open.

Admin - This is a member of staff. Admins administrate (duh) and monitor chat.

Head Admin - This is a member of staff. Head Admins watch over admins to make sure they are doing their job right. 

Assistant Manager - This is a person that assists kylo with anything he needs, basically someone cooler than anyone else in the server :)

Manager - the one and only kylo, you won't get this rank.. ever..

Ghoul - The owner of the server. You also will never get this rank, ever.

That's about it. If you've got any questions, message kylo. 
**NOTE: This will be updated.**

actions.message:
**__Moderation Commands__**
*?purge - Deletes a given number of messages.*
*?mute - Mutes a member so that they cannot type.*
*?kick - Removes a member from the discord. They are able to rejoin after, however.*
*?ban - Removes a member from the discord ** permanently.***
*?warn - Warns a user for a specific reason.*

**__Miscellaneous Bot Commands__**
*?whois - Gives you information about a mentioned user. Running this command will give you the name, discord tag, join date, and account creation date.*
*?rank - Tells you what level you are, as well as how much experience points you have.*
*?help - Brings up this box of information.*
*?afk - Puts [AFK] in front of your name so that people know you aren't available to talk. Using this command a second time will remove [AFK] from your name.*
*?gstart - Starts a giveaway.*
*?rolemenu - Creates a role-reaction menu.*
*?robloxuser - Gives information on a Roblox user.*
*?staffapp - Creates a new staff application.*
*?report - Reports a user and sends it to moderators.*
*?announce - Announces events (staff only.)*
*?serverinfo - Gives information about the server.*


**__Fun Commands__**
*?meme - Sends a random meme, must be sent in the #memes channel.*
*?dadjoke - Sends a random dad joke.*

**__Support__**
If you have any questions about the bot, you can message me @ kylo#4965.


*This bot was created by kylo#4965, and was made for the official Wendigo Ro-Ghoul group.*
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Hello! You are receiving this message because you ran the **?staffapp** command. The format to apply for staff is below, fill out the template and send it to the #apply-for-staff channel.
**Abuse of this system will result in punishment.**

**Question 1**
What is your Roblox username? - 

**Question 2** 
How long have you been in Wendigo? -

**Question 3**
How active are you in both the Discord and the Ro-Ghoul game itself?-

**Question 4** 
Do you have experience as a member of staff in another server? If so, list the names of the servers, as well as your positions. -

**Question 5**
How old are you? - 

**Question 6**
What is your time zone? If you do not know, look it up. -

**Question 7**
Why would you like to be a member of staff at Wendigo? -

**Question 8**
What days are you able to be on? - 

**Question 9**
What position are you applying for? -

This is the end of the application. Send this message in the #apply-for-staff channel and the staff will review it.
